keyword: how many calories in a drink of whiskey
title: How Many Calories in a Drink of Whiskey?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a drink of whiskey, including nutrition facts, basis per serving, and tweaks for mixes—all from alcohol with zero carbs or sugars.
h1: How Many Calories in a Drink of Whiskey?
assumptions: Standard drink: 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) of 80-proof (40% ABV) whiskey, served neat or straight, no mixers.
disclaimer: Calories vary by proof, brand, exact serving size, and any added mixers. Pure distilled spirits contain no carbs, fats, or proteins. Consult labels for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard drink of whiskey has about 97 calories, derived entirely from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Double shot (3 fl oz instead of 1.5 fl oz)
Mixed with 4 oz diet soda (zero-calorie mixer)
Mixed with 4 oz regular cola (adds ~50 kcal from sugar)

faqs.q: How many calories in a standard drink of whiskey?
faqs.a: About 97 kcal for 1.5 fl oz of 80-proof whiskey.

faqs.q: Does whiskey have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: No—pure whiskey has 0 g carbs, fiber, and sugars; calories are from alcohol only.
Proof (higher ABV means more calories), serving size, and mixers like soda or juice.

faqs.q: Calories in whiskey vs. other spirits?
faqs.a: Similar to vodka or gin at ~97 kcal per 1.5 fl oz standard drink; varies slightly by type.

faqs.q: Is whiskey low-carb for keto diets?
faqs.a: Yes, straight whiskey is keto-friendly with 0 g net carbs, but avoid sugary mixers.
